author: WHAM Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Fantastic weather is in the forecast on Martin Luther King Jr Day with temperatures climbing throughout the week... We will wrap up the weekend with a storm moving in on Sunday...{/p}{p}TODAY: If you're heading downtown to the MLK Day Parade, temperatures will be around 50 degrees at 10 am. Expect partly cloudy skies on Monday with high temperatures reaching 58 degrees in Las Vegas. Winds will stay light out of the north up to 10 mph throughout the day.{/p}{p}Air quality is ranked 'good' for most valley neighborhoods with levels 'unhealthy for sensitive groups' in the east valley. Pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will be mostly clear this evening with cold valley low temperatures dropping to around 39 degrees.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: Temperatures will keep climbing throughout the work week with highs in the low to mid 60s as high pressure builds. A storm will move into the West Coast on Wednesday, bringing rain and snow showers to Northern Nevada. Temperatures will max out around 65 degrees on Saturday in Las Vegas, followed by a stronger storm moving into Southern Nevada on Sunday. A slight chance of rain showers will be possible in the valley on Sunday (about 20% chance) with light rain amounts anticipated. Forecast totals will be anything from a trace up to .10\". Mountain snow will be more likely on Sunday but the heaviest snow is forecast for the Sierra Mountains to our west. In between the two storms this week some parts of the Sierra will get up to 30\" of snow from now into the start of NEXT week.{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day forecast, rain shower chances will linger in Las Vegas Sunday through Monday with highs in the 50s. Conditions appear to clear up by NEXT Tuesday and Wednesday with valley highs rebounding back to the mid 60s under mostly sunny to partly cloudy skies.{/p}{p}Check back for more updates & have a great day!{/p}{p}- Chloe Koast{ }{/p}{p}{br}{/p}{p}A winter storm dumped more than a foot of snow in parts of New York, including in Orchard Park, resulting in the postponement of the AFC wild-card playoff game against the Buffalo Bills and the Pittsburgh Steelers.{/p}{p}Crews got right to work Monday morning, as they cleared a massive amount of snow from the parking lots and walkways outside the Highmark Stadium ahead of the game.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-file=\"1746965471830917148\" data-embed-type=\"twitter\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}{a href=\"https://13wham.com/news/local/bills-fans-unfazed-by-winter-weather-ahead-of-rescheduled-playoff-game-snow-orchard-park-buffalo-pittsburgh-steelers#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://13wham.com/news/local/bills-fans-unfazed-by-winter-weather-ahead-of-rescheduled-playoff-game-snow-orchard-park-buffalo-pittsburgh-steelers#\"}Fans brought shovels inside{/a} to clear the stands for themselves and fellow fans, with several seen digging their way to their seats.{br}{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"BuffaloBills_SNOW_SL%20-%20Made%20with%20Clipchamp\" data-embed-type=\"video\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Many of them said they wouldn't miss this playoff game for anything, no matter the cold.{br}{/p}{blockQuote: }I love the weather games,\" said John Martek. \"I’m hoping we beat the Steelers. I know we're gonna beat the Steelers, and I want to see Kansas City (come here for) a road playoff game next week.\"{/blockQuote: }{blockQuote: }I got my Carhartt pants on, I got cold weather gear on underneath, I got a pair of mittens for the game,\" he continued. \"Other than that, I’m ready to go.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Mike and Reagan Kelley drove from Newtown, Connecticut to Orchard Park to watch their favorite team.{/p}{blockQuote: }We had some rain, but we got here just as the snow was starting,\" Mike said.{/blockQuote: }{blockQuote: }Yeah, it was just snow flurries,\" Reagan said. \"It was cold, but we got here just before it hit.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}And they came prepared for the weather.{/p}{blockQuote: }We’ve got heated vests and socks and a lot of hats and we’re going to bring cardboard,\" Reagan said. \"It’s good to stand on or sit on because it keeps you warm.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Every Bills fan said the same thing: \"Go Bills!\"{/p}{p}Fantastic weather is in the forecast on Martin Luther King Jr Day with temperatures climbing throughout the week... We will wrap up the weekend with a storm moving in on Sunday...{/p}{p}TODAY: If you're heading downtown to the MLK Day Parade, temperatures will be around 50 degrees at 10 am. Expect partly cloudy skies on Monday with high temperatures reaching 58 degrees in Las Vegas. Winds will stay light out of the north up to 10 mph throughout the day.{/p}{p}Air quality is ranked 'good' for most valley neighborhoods with levels 'unhealthy for sensitive groups' in the east valley. Pollen levels are low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will be mostly clear this evening with cold valley low temperatures dropping to around 39 degrees.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: Temperatures will keep climbing throughout the work week with highs in the low to mid 60s as high pressure builds. A storm will move into the West Coast on Wednesday, bringing rain and snow showers to Northern Nevada. Temperatures will max out around 65 degrees on Saturday in Las Vegas, followed by a stronger storm moving into Southern Nevada on Sunday. A slight chance of rain showers will be possible in the valley on Sunday (about 20% chance) with light rain amounts anticipated. Forecast totals will be anything from a trace up to .10\". Mountain snow will be more likely on Sunday but the heaviest snow is forecast for the Sierra Mountains to our west. In between the two storms this week some parts of the Sierra will get up to 30\" of snow from now into the start of NEXT week.{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day forecast, rain shower chances will linger in Las Vegas Sunday through Monday with highs in the 50s. Conditions appear to clear up by NEXT Tuesday and Wednesday with valley highs rebounding back to the mid 60s under mostly sunny to partly cloudy skies.{/p}{p}Check back for more updates & have a great I know we're gonna beat the Steelers, and I want to see Kansas City (come here for) a road playoff game next week.\"{/blockQuote: }{blockQuote: }I got my Carhartt pants on, I got cold weather gear on underneath, I got a pair of mittens for the game,\" he continued. \"Other than that, I’m ready to go.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Mike and Reagan Kelley drove from Newtown, Connecticut to Orchard Park to watch their favorite team.{/p}{blockQuote: }We had some rain, but we got here just as the snow was starting,\" Mike said.{/blockQuote: }{blockQuote: }Yeah, it was just snow flurries,\" Reagan said. \"It was cold, but we got here just before it hit.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}And they came prepared for the weather.{/p}{blockQuote: }We’ve got heated vests and socks and a lot of hats and we’re going to bring cardboard,\" Reagan said. \"It’s good to stand on or sit on because it keeps you warm.\"{/blockQuote: }{p}Every Bills fan said the same thing: \"Go Bills!\"{/p}
